quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Lights and Ark
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, ark, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What are the lights in our homes wired in?
The fat is hot enough to fry in when green smoke rises from the pan.
The normal body temperature is 37.5 ºC.
There are 20 consonants in the English alphabet.
The traffic lights has three colors. Yellow is in the middle.
How many directions does the compass have?
What type of wood did Noah build the ark out of?
Which of these animals is considered to have the best immune system?
General Santa Anna , loser at San Juancinto and victor at the Alamo, went on to help promote what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chewing gum

questions.question: What is the missing word in these lyrics taken from a traditional folk song of the Southern United States?
What bird can be associated with the infectious disease Varicella?
How many stanzas is The Philippine National Anthem composed of?
The pitch of the guitar string becomes lower when it is tightened.
The telephone handset has two main parts. One is the mouthpiece or transmitter. What is the other one?
Humans have 33 permanent teeth.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Head and Tabby
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, winkle, tabby. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two landlocked countries are surrounded by other landlocked countries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liechtenstein and Uzbekistan

questions.question: Which is the only US state famous for producing limburger cheese in the Chalet Cheese Co-op factory?
How often can a healthy adult donate blood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: every 8 weeks

questions.question: A tabby is a type of domesticated cat with tiger-like stripes and silky fur. Where does the word tabby come from?

options.text: A corruption of Tabitha, a name long associated with cats and the devil
A district of a city in China
A corruption of its Latin name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A suburb of Baghdad

questions.question: What did Erik Rotheim invent in 1926?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The aerosol spray can

questions.question: Which movie, set in New York City, was written by Calogero Lorenzo Palminteri and directed by Robert De Niro?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Bronx Tale - 1993

questions.question: Of all the invertebrates, which has the best eyesight?
Who was Robert Van Winkle ?

options.text: A fictional character who slept for many years
The first winner of the Congressional  Medal of Honor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanilla Ice

questions.question: Who played keyboards on the Beach Boys hits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darryl Dragon

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of a jellyfish is water ?
In every country in the world, except one, moving the head up and down means yes and moving the head side-to-side means no. In what one nation is that not the case?
What album is considered to be the first rap record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugar Hill Gangss Rappers Delight

questions.question: Which one of these inventions hit the market in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The compact disk

questions.question: Which actor plays a 121 years old character who tells a news reporter about his life with the Indians and the battle of Little Big Horn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dustin Hoffman

questions.question: Who built the famous monument Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shah Jehan

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Video and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Of the 8 major blood types, which is the most common?

options.text: Except for Advanced Placement  classes, all classes are taught in Latin.
Studying at least four foreign languages is mandatory.
Although it is a Catholic school, Hebrew is a required subject.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unicycling is a mandatory subject.

questions.question: What is a moirologist?

options.text: Someone paid to mourn at a funeral
A trademark used as a generic term

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Someone paid to mourn at a funeral

questions.question: Which of these is best for cooling your mouth if you have just eaten very spicy food?
Which actor sued a Los Angeles magazine for publishing a computer-generated image of him wearing a dress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dustin Hoffman

questions.question: Neil Armstrong was the first man to walk on the moon on July 20th, 1969. Who was the astronaut that followed him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edwin Buzz Aldrin

questions.question: What are conjugate angles?

options.text: Two angles that add up to 90 degrees
Two angles that add up to 360 degrees
Two angles that add up to 180 degrees
Two angles that add up to 0 degrees

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two angles that add up to 360 degrees

questions.question: What invention is credited to American Melville R. Bissell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The carpet sweeper

questions.question: John Adams was the second President of the United States. Who was the second Vice-President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which US state had the most estimated farmland for 2000?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Benatar, You Better Run

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Gum and Bubble
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, diemer, pink. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was Disneys second full length animated film?

options.text: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.question: This is one of the benefits of chewing gum.

options.text: Enhances the function of the lungs
Helps resist the urge to smoke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helps resist the urge to smoke

If you stick bubble gum in your hair, you can remove it with a small amount of this substance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peanut butter

questions.question: Ancient Greeks also had their bubble gum. They chewed the resin of this tree to clean their teeth and freshen their breath.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mastic tree

questions.question: Bazooka introduced the first bubble gum comics named Bazooka Joe. It was first introduced in this year.
To remove gum from clothes or other fabrics you should apply this first.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice cube

questions.question: This is the most popular color of bubble gum.  When gum had to be released on the market, it was the only color the inventor had on hand.

The Beatles first #1 hit on the US Billboard charts was I Want to Hold Your Hand.  What was their second #1 hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She Loves You

questions.question: The invetor of the first marketed bubble gum, Walter Diemer, was actually an accountant at Fleer Chewing Gum Company in Philadelphia. He did various experiments in his free time. He invented bubble gum by accident, when one of his gum mixtures turned out to be less sticky than the usual chewing gum mixture and easily stretched.  When did he invent the bubble gum?
This was the name of the first bubble gum on the market.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dubble Bubble

questions.question: According to the 1990 US census the most common surname is Smith. What is the second most common name?
